result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Waligorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 23 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Maintain full-time employment.  No contact with victim/witness/co-defendant.  No contact with the Salvation Army or the Speedway on Grand Ave.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: with Standard Release Conditions-STAYED for compliance for 90 days with the Day Report Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Waligorski

Reviewed by the Court, any more problems and the defendant will need to do a minimum of 3 meetings a week.

WCS Day Report Center Informational Court Report.
Reviewed by the Court.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court conducts plea colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty. Case 14CM2322 is dismissed and read into 15CM148. 

Court orders the following:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED 23 Days of credit if revoked
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation $100 of the posted cash bail on 14CM2322 to be applied and $100 to be refunded to the poster
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  Maintain full-time employment. No contact with victim/witness/co-defendant. No contact with the Salvation Army or the Speedway on Grand Ave. Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  


CONDITION TIME: 60 Days WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for compliance for 90 days with the Day Report Center.
Defendant Mark A Waligorski in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark A Waligorski
Current: 129 W Broadway, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 02-04-2015)
Prior: 332 Wisconsin Ave,#1W, Waukesha, WI 53186
Hearing on February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark A Waligorski in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a further proceedings date. Defense requests that the defendant's bail be modified to a signature bond. Court will not modify bail at this time.  Court allows the defendant one free phone call.  Hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/ Salvation Army listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Mark A Waligorski in court, in custody, with attorney Beth Weathers for Joseph Smith.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
